title: The use of associated types in `type` crashes even though it doesn't support type bounds at all

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
``` rust
$ rustc -V
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (44a287e6e 2015-01-08 17:03:40 -0800)

$ cat t.rs
fn main() { struct P<A, B>; type Q<C> = P<C::A, C::B>; }

$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc t.rs
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', /home/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/libcore
/option.rs:330
```
